member.name: WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT
member.summary: The layout rules applied to the elements of the WS-Security security header. This setting is relevant to message security bindings and mixed-mode security bindings.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT.WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT_STRICT
member.summary: The elements of the security header must follow a 'declare before use' layout. All security tokens must appear before their usage.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT.WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT_LAX
member.summary: The elements of the security header can be in arbitrary order, including security tokens appearing after usage.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT.WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT_LAX_WITH_TIMESTAMP_FIRST
member.summary: The elements of the security header can be in arbitrary order as in , but the timestamp element must be the first element.

member.name: WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT.WS_SECURITY_HEADER_LAYOUT_LAX_WITH_TIMESTAMP_LAST
member.summary: The elements of the security header can be in arbitrary order as in , but the timestamp element must be the last element.
